instructions:
Place the pork butts in a 12 quart stock pot and almost cover with water. Add the 2 tbsp salt and 2 tsp
pepper, bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 1 hour. Remove roasts to a cutting board and cut to
remove bone. Then slice meat across the grain in 1 1/4 inch slices. Place slices on 2 Pammed broiling racks
with pans in a 350 F oven for a total of 1 hour. Turn meat at 30 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside to
cool.
In a 6 quart pot, add olive oil and sauté the chopped onion over medium heat for about 4 minutes. Add the
garlic and continue sautéing for another 1 minute. Then add all remaining ingredients. Bring the sauce to a
boil, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 30 minutes. When meat has cooled, shred with forks or
fingers and remove any bones and gristle. Place the shredded meat in the bottom broiling pans. Mix only
enough sauce with the meat to make a soupy mixture, scraping the bottom of the pans to include the dried
meat juices. There may be excess sauce. Flatten the mixture with a spatula and return pans to a 400 F oven
for 15 minute or until slightly brown. Do not burn.
Place 2 rounded serving spoons of the barbecued pork on each toasted hamburger bun along with a
serving spoon of Cole slaw. Makes about 30 sandwiches.
ingredients: 2 (4 to 5 lb ea) pork butt roasts
1 btl (28 oz) Kraft Original Barbecue Sauce
name: Aunt Cora's Pork Barbecue
creator: Cora Decker
